Package com.esri.mo2.ui.cat

Provides a user interface component for selecting and displaying information about GIS data objects.

See:
          Description

Class Summary
Catalog This class contains the catalog tree and associated property panels.
CatalogFrame This is a simple container for the Catalog bean
CatalogNode provides support for the appearance of nodes in the tree
CatalogTree This class manages the display of Content within a Tree control.
ContentPanel this is the panel that appears in the Properties/Contents tab whenever a Shapefile has been selected in the CatalogTree
FolderPanel this is the panel that appears in the Properties/Contents tab whenever a Folder has been selected in the CatalogTree
MapPanel this reusable panel contains a Map for previewing purposes
MapTablePanel this reusable panel contains a Map and a Table for previewing purposes
MessagePanel a simple panel that can be used to display a message, typically to indicate that there is a problem.
PreviewPanel this is a reusable container for the preview panel variants (depending upon content type)
PropertyPanel this is a collection of tabs containing different property sheets.
PropertyPanelTab This class encapsulates all the information regarding one "tab" within a PropertyPanel
TablePanel simple viewer of table data
ToolbarPanel This toolbar is specific to the CatalogFrame.
TreeUtility utility methods for working with the CatalogTree.
 

Package com.esri.mo2.ui.cat Description

Provides a user interface component for selecting and displaying information about GIS data objects.

By default, data can be obtained from three connection types:

  • The local file system
  • ArcSDE databases
  • ArcIMS 4 Web sites
Additional connection types can be configured for display if desired. Each data object is represented by an icon, and tool tips are provided that give a short description of the data.

Catalog provides a tree view on the left side of its user interface, plus it provides further information abour the GIS data objects in a property panel on the right-hand side. By clicking the icon that represents a particular GIS data object, properties of the object and an optional preview may be displayed in the Property panel.

A simple Frame class is provided for Catalog to make it easy to show these objects within a popup dialog.
